description: A federal intelligence bulletin, authored by FBI, DHS and NCTC, warns of potential violent extremism in response to the one-year mark of the Oct. 7 attack on Israel.
title: One-year mark of Oct. 7 attack prompts bulletin warning of violent extremism

description: Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz admitted during the debate that he had previously misspoken in 2014 when he said he was in mainland China between April and June 1989, during the Tiananmen Square protests.
title: Walz says he had his dates wrong, admits he didn't travel to China until August 1989

description: Special counsel Jack Smith's unsealed court filing revealed new evidence in the federal election interference case against former President Donald Trump. Over the summer, the Supreme Court ruled that Trump has immunity for official acts conducted as president. CBS News legal contributor Jessica Levinson breaks down the decision's impact on Trump's case.
title: How presidential immunity ruling impacts Trump's election interference case

description: Some families in Israel celebrated Rosh Hashanah Wednesday without their loved ones nearly a year after they were taken hostage by Hamas. CBS News senior foreign correspondent Elizabeth Palmer reports from the public plaza renamed Hostage Square in Tel Aviv. CBS News Digital international reporter Haley Ott reports on an Israeli family working to bring home their relative held hostage in Gaza.
title: Israeli monument honors hostages as families celebrate Rosh Hashanah

description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu vowed retaliation against Iran for its missile attack against Israel Tuesday. When Iran attacked Israel in April, Israel responded with a limited strike. Jon Alterman, senior vice president and director of the Middle East program at the Center for Strategic and International Studies, joins CBS News to discuss how the prime minister could respond now.
title: Analyzing Netanyahu's Iran, Hezbollah approach

description: John Dickerson reports on the findings from a newly unsealed filing regarding the Trump 2020 election case, escalating conflict in the Middle East, and the status of recovery and cleanup operations in the Southeast following Hurricane Helene.
title: 10/2: The Daily Report with John Dickerson

description: Sen. JD Vance of Ohio and Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz were back on the campaign trail Wednesday, one day after the only scheduled vice presidential debate hosted by CBS News. On Tuesday night, they found moments of middle ground while debating health care, gun control and the economy. CBS News chief Washington correspondent Major Garrett has more.
title: Vance, Walz said a version of "I agree with my opponent" at least 10 times

description: U.S. dock workers on the East and Gulf coasts have been on strike for two days with no union deal in sight. The workers are demanding wage hikes and a complete ban on the use of automated cranes, gates and container-moving trucks in unloading or loading freight. CBS News' Nancy Chen has more on their concerns.
title: Why dockworkers are so concerned about automation

description: Tennessee officials are investigating a plastics factory in Erwin after 11 workers were swept away Friday by raging floodwaters from Helene. Five were rescued, two died and four others remain unaccounted for. CBS News national correspondent Manuel Bojorquez reports on the investigation and rescue efforts.
title: Tennesse investigates factory after Helene floodwaters swept employees away

description: A U.S. bomb from World War II that had been buried at a Japanese airport exploded Wednesday. Japanese officials said the incident caused 80 flight cancellations, but no injuries.
title: American WWII bomb buried at Japanese airport explodes

description: Judge Tanya Chutkan, who is overseeing former President Donald Trump's election interference case, unsealed part of a 165-page report by special counsel Jack Smith, who argued that Trump's alleged attempt to overturn the results of the 2020 election was done as a private candidate, rather than in an official capacity. CBS News chief legal correspondent Jan Crawford has more.
title: Unsealed filing in Trump election case reveals grand jury testimony

description: As the world awaits Israel's response to Iran's missile attack, the Israeli military continues its ground operations in southern Lebanon. Israel Defense Forces released a video Wednesday showing troops advancing through the region as it announced the deaths of eight soldiers killed in "intense fighting" with Hezbollah militants. CBS News foreign correspondent Chris Livesay reports.
title: Israeli military's video shows troops conducting ground operation in Lebanon

description: Sales of BB and pellet guns that look like real firearms are rising,  but their similarity to firearms has led to dozens of police shootings.
title: How replica guns are getting Americans killed

description: Since 2014, at least 320 people have been shot and killed by police while holding replica guns, and of those at least 19 were children. Police say that many replica guns look so real that officers are unable to distinguish them from regular firearms. And even though many states are trying to keep realistic replica guns out of kids' hands, there's evidence that manufacturers have been marketing directly to them for years. Anna Werner explains.
title: How replica guns are creating challenges for police

description: After Iran fired nearly 200 missiles at Israel Tuesday --nearly all of them intercepted by Israel's missile defense systems and the help of U.S. destroyers based in the Eastern Mediterranean-- Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu indicated that Israel will respond. The Israeli military also said Wednesday that eight of its soldiers were killed in fighting with Hezbollah in southern Lebanon. Chris Livesay reports from Tel Aviv, and Imtiaz Tyab reports from Beirut.
title: Israel fights Hezbollah in southern Lebanon, plans to retaliate to Iran missile attack

description: One day after they faced off in the vice presidential debate, Sen. JD Vance of Ohio and Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz were back on the campaign trail Wednesday. A new CBS News poll found that viewers saw the debate as a pretty even matchup. Robert Costa has the latest.
title: Vance, Walz hit campaign trail after VP debate

description: President Biden traveled to the Carolinas Wednesday to view the scope of the devastation firsthand from Hurricane Helene. At least 180 deaths have been attributed to the storm across six states. Skyler Henry reports from Asheville, North Carolina.
title: Biden surveys Helene destruction as search for survivors continues

description: Here's a look at the top stories making headlines on the "CBS Evening News with Norah O'Donnell."
title: "CBS Evening News" headlines for Wednesday, Oct. 2, 2024

description: A substantial court filing by special counsel Jack Smith in the 2020 election case against former President Donald Trump was unsealed by a federal judge Wednesday. In it, Smith argues that Trump "resorted to crimes" after losing the election to President Biden. The case had been thrown into doubt when the Supreme Court ruled in July that a president cannot be prosecuted for what it called official acts. Scott MacFarlane has details.
title: Special counsel filing unsealed in Trump 2020 election case

description: A 12-year-old girl in Michigan won a statewide contest to redesign the traditional "I voted" logo. It will feature on one of nine stickers that Michigan voters receive after casting their ballots this year.
title: Michigan girl, 12, creates memorable election season artwork

description: CBS News analyzed the words Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz and Sen. JD Vance of Ohio used most often during their debate Tuesday.
title: Words the VP candidates used most often during the debate

description: The wildfire on Maui last year erupted from an earlier brushfire caused by downed power lines that firefighters believed they had extinguished, officials said Wednesday.
title: Maui wildfire erupted from brushfire believed to be extinguished, investigation finds

description: It's no secret that Russia and Iran are trying to influence the 2024 election, and have been behind previously successful hacks of presidential campaigns. CBS News intelligence and national security reporter Olivia Gazis spoke with National Cyber Director Harry Coker about his biggest concerns ahead of Election Day.
title: National cyber director lays out biggest threats to 2024 election

description: Former President Donald Trump had more than a dozen seasons of "The Apprentice" to cast himself as a businessman and a dealmaker, but a new book is claiming that is all a lie. Russ Buettner, New York Times investigative reporter and author of "Lucky Loser," joins "America Decides" to discuss.
title: New book claims Trump fabricated his business success

description: The vice presidential nominees were civil as they sparred during the CBS News debate Tuesday night. So who do voters think did a better job? Anthony Salvanto, CBS News executive director of elections and surveys, Shelby Talcott, politics reporter for Semafor, and Fin Gómez, CBS News political director, join with more.
title: VP debate viewers split on who won, CBS News poll finds

description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is vowing retaliation for Tuesday's Iran missile attack. Most missiles did not get through Israeli defense systems, but some did. CBS News foreign correspondent Chris Livesay is near Tel Aviv with the latest.
title: Some Iranian missiles penetrate Israeli defense systems

description: Republican Sen. JD Vance of Ohio and Democratic Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz faced off at CBS News' vice presidential debate Tuesday night. CBS News national correspondent Jericka Duncan sat down with some voters in Grand Rapids, Michigan, to gauge their thoughts on the match-up.
title: Voters in Michigan react to Vance-Walz debate

description: Judge Tanya Chutkan on Wednesday made public portions of a key filing in former President Donald Trump's federal 2020 election interference case. Harry Litman, former deputy assistant attorney general, joins "America Decides" with analysis.
title: Takeaways from Jack Smith's unsealed brief in Trump election case

description: A federal judge unsealed new evidence Wednesday in former President Donald Trump's 2020 election interference case. Trump has pleaded not guilty to the four charges in the case, including conspiracy to defraud the U.S. CBS News' Jan Crawford, Robert Costa and Nancy Cordes have the latest.
title: Breaking down newly unsealed evidence in Trump 2020 election case

description: The FDA has until early 2026 to decide on the submission for a sunscreen ingredient branded as PARSOL Shield.
title: FDA weighing approval of first new sunscreen ingredient in decades

description: Vice President Kamala Harris said she won't ban fracking natural gas.
title: Harris says she won't ban fracking

description: The judge in the federal election interference case against former President Donald Trump unsealed a key filing that includes new evidence from special counsel Jack Smith on Wednesday. Smith filed the motion after the Supreme Court ruled Trump is immune from official acts he conducted as president. Rebecca Roiphe, CBS News legal contributor, Derek Muller, law professor at the University of Notre Dame Law School, and Robert Legare, CBS News Justice Department reporter, join with analysis.
title: Judge unseals crucial Jack Smith documents in Trump 2020 election case

description: Vice President Kamala Harris spoke about the federal cleanup and recovery efforts in the wake of Hurricane Helene in Augusta, Georgia, on Wednesday. Earlier, President Biden authorized the deployment of active-duty U.S. soldiers who will join federal personnel to help states impacted by the storm.
title: Kamala Harris speaks about Hurricane Helene recovery efforts

description: Rates on home equity loans are in decline. Here's how much a $25,000 loan will cost now that rates have been cut.
title: Here's what a $25,000 home equity loan costs monthly now that rates were cut

description: The Department of Homeland Security released its latest threat assessment as the conflict in the Middle East grows and more information about mass casualty offenders emerges. CBS News' Nicole Sganga has more on the analysis.
title: DHS releases 2025 homeland threat assessment

description: In the United States, the presidential candidate who gets the most votes isn't necessarily the candidate who wins. This is the Electoral College — explained.
title: The Electoral College – explained

description: U.S. State Department spokesperson Matthew Miller weighed in on President Biden's comments addressing the possibility of targeting Iran's nuclear sites after the attack against Israel. Miller said the U.S. will continue to consult with Israeli officials about a potential response against Iran after escalating tensions in the region.
title: State Department on White House response to Iran attack against Israel

description: President Biden weighed in on the possibility of striking Iran's nuclear sites after its attack against Israel Tuesday. Mr. Biden commented on the Middle East and the U.S. port strikes as he travels to survey Helene damage in the South. CBS News campaign reporters Nidia Cavazos and Taurean Small have more.
title: Biden weighs in on Iran attack, port strikes and Helene destruction

description: Judge Tanya Chutkan has released a key filing in special counsel Jack Smith's case against former President Donald Trump in Washington, D.C.
title: Judge unseals crucial special counsel filing in Trump 2020 election case

description: A doctor criminally charged in connection with the death of actor Matthew Perry pleaded guilty Wednesday to a federal charge of conspiracy to distribute ketamine, which carries a maximum possible sentence of 10 years in prison.
title: Doctor admits to role Matthew Perry's death, pleads guilty to federal charge

description: President Biden to survey destruction left behind by Hurricane Helene in North and South Carolina; Takeaways from the VP debate between JD Vance and Tim Walz.
title: 10/2: CBS News 24/7 Episode 2

description: There are not yet many details on Israel's response to Iran's missile attack launched Tuesday. No more information is expected before an operation is carried out, CBS News' Haley Ott reports from Tel Aviv.
title: Israel promises major response to Iran attack

description: Bank of America customers are reporting problems accessing their online accounts, according to DownDetector.
title: Bank of America customers report outage, with some seeing $0 balances

description: Fans can now cast their votes for the bulkiest grizzlies in Alaska's Katmai National Park, as the 2024 Fat Bear Week contest begins.
title: Voting begins in Alaska's Fat Bear Week after grizzly killed on video

description: If you've been waiting for your credit card interest rates to fall, here's where rates could head this month.
title: How far will credit card interest rates fall in October?

description: Gov. Tim Walz during the Vice Presidential debate on Tuesday night revealed that his teenage son Gus had witnessed a shooting at a community center in St. Paul last year.
title: Gov. Tim Walz says son Gus witnessed shooting at St. Paul rec center

description: Thousands of dockworkers have entered a second day of striking as contract negotiations stall due to disagreements around automation. CBS News' Nancy Chen reports.
title: Latest news on port strikes that may affect supply chain

description: New York City Mayor Eric Adams could face more charges against him after pleading not guilty to five federal counts. CBS News' Nikki Battiste has more on the possibility of expanded charges or more people being charged in connection to Adams' case.
title: Eric Adams could face more charges

description: Interest rates are dropping. But that doesn't mean that you should wait for home equity loan rates to fall further.
title: Why you shouldn't wait for home equity loan rates to drop any further

description: Fewer young people are having sex, but the teens and young adults who are sexually active aren't using condoms as regularly, if at all.
title: Condom use is declining among younger generations. Here's why.

description: As Trump and Harris remain in a close race, voters in Georgia discuss key issues like the economy and rising prices in CBS Mornings' "Three Meals" series.
title: Three Meals: Georgia voters voice concerns ahead of 2024 election

description: In Tuesday's vice presidential debate, Sen. JD Vance claimed that housing in the U.S. "is totally unaffordable" due to immigrants. Here's what to know.
title: Vance says immigration is causing a housing crunch. Here's what to know.

description: An 81-year-old Montana man was sentenced to six months in federal prison for illegally using sheep tissue to create hybrids for trophy hunting.
title: Montana man sentenced to six months in prison for illegally creating hybrid sheep

description: Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz and Ohio Sen. JD Vance stuck to policy and remained cordial during the vice presidential debate in New York City. Political strategists Joel Payne and Maura Gillespie break down the possible impact of the VP debate for both candidates.
title: How Vance, Walz struck a cordial tone and focused on policy

description: Vice President Kamala Harris is surveying Helene storm damage as former President Donald Trump continues touring battleground states. CBS News campaign reporters Jake Rosen and Aaron Navarro have more on the candidates after Helene, the vice presidential debate and Iran's attack against Israel.
title: What's next for Trump, Harris after VP debate?

description: President Biden and Vice President Kamala Harris are surveying Helene damage after the storm swept inland and devastated parts of Georgia and North Carolina. CBS News' Skyler Henry reports.
title: Biden, Harris to see Helene damage

description: CBS News chief political analyst John Dickerson breaks down the vice presidential debate between Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz and Sen. JD Vance.
title: Breaking down the VP debate between Walz and Vance

description: Ohio Sen. JD Vance and Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz were mostly cordial and focused on policy during the vice presidential debate, but both traded jabs at times that targeted their running mates. CBS News' Zak Hudak breaks down some memorable moments from the VP debate.
title: How JD Vance, Tim Walz called each other out during the VP debate

description: Israel has vowed to respond to Iran's missile attack Tuesday.  CBS News' Imtiaz Tyab reports from Lebanon as he surveys damage from Israeli strikes against Hezbollah, and CBS News contributor Sam Vinograd provides more analysis of Iran's attack.
title: World awaits Israel response to Iran attack

description: Efforts are ramping up to help feed Helene survivors and provide more support across the South. In Asheville, North Carolina, World Central Kitchen activation manager John Torpey is helping feed hundreds who have lost most of their possessions. Torpey joins CBS News with more on the efforts.
title: Efforts to feed Helene victims across South

description: Rwanda declared an outbreak of the highly contagious Marburg virus​, a deadly hemorrhagic fever that has no authorized vaccine or treatment.
title: What to know about Marburg virus as Ebola-like outbreak kills 8 in Rwanda

description: If you're worried about missing a credit card payment this month, there may be solutions worth considering now.
title: Can't pay your October credit card bill? Here's what to do.

description: Savers can still earn big returns with a CD now, even with the recent rate cut. Here's how much they'd make with a $5,000 deposit.
title: How much will a $5,000 CD earn now that rates are cut?

description: British pop star Jess Glynne shares her excitement of being back on stage and her commitment to staying authentic in her music.
title: Jess Glynne on new album, U.S. Tour and embracing authenticity

description: Colin Kaepernick, who remains dedicated to returning to the NFL, reflects on his passion for football, balancing his activism and his new children's book.
title: Colin Kaepernick on new children's book and his desire to play in the NFL

description: A treasure hunt​ that spanned much of the northeast before being narrowed to Massachusetts​ has turned up gold.
title: Treasure hunt trophy found in Massachusetts, but who won?

description: Video played in court that showed the moment a Kentucky judge was fatally shot in his chambers by a former sheriff charged in his murder.
title: Video of judge being shot to death shown at court hearing

description: Home equity loan rates are low right now, but you still need to know what the monthly costs would be if you borrow.
title: How much would a $75,000 home equity loan cost per month after rate cuts?

description: CBS News polling shows both JD Vance and Tim Walz got a boost in their favorability ratings following Tuesday night's debate. CBS News campaign reporters Aaron Navarro and Zak Hudak have more on how each campaign is reacting.
title: Vance, Walz see favorability boosts after debate in new CBS News poll

description: Google brings new interactive summary cards to Gmail inboxes to help users track purchases, events.
title: Gmail users get new summary cards to track purchases, events

description: Coast Guard crew members found 142 "brick-sized packages" that tested positive for cocaine inside a small boat.
title: Coast Guard seizes $4.3 million of cocaine from boat near Puerto Rico

description: Oprah Winfrey selected "Tell Me Everything" by Elizabeth Strout as her latest book club pick. Watch the author, Elizabeth Strout, read an excerpt from her book that follows a friendship between 91-year-old Olive and acclaimed writer Lucy Barton.
title: Oprah's Book Club: Author Elizabeth Strout reads "Tell Me Everything" excerpt

description: Oprah Winfrey selected " Tell Me Everything" by Elizabeth Strout as her latest book club selection. Watch the author Elizabeth Strout answer reader guide questions about her novel about love, loneliness and the human need for connection.
title: Oprah's Book Club: Author Elizabeth Strout discusses reader's guide for "Tell Me Everything"

description: Walz and Vance face off in policy-focused VP debate; Traces of carbon dioxide found on Pluto's moon.
title: 10/2: CBS News 24/7 Episode 1

description: President Biden will travel to North and South Carolina Wednesday for a first-hand look at the destruction left by Hurricane Helene. The death toll from the storm has now passed 160 people. CBS News correspondent Skyler Henry has more.
title: Biden heads to Carolinas to survey damage from Helene

description: President Biden will survey damage from the air and get a briefing from officials on the ground.
title: Biden heads to Carolinas to survey Hurricane Helene damage

description: The U.S. has called Tuesday's Iranian missile attack against Israel a significant escalation with the threat of wider war in the Middle East now seemingly at a tipping point. CBS News reporter Olivia Gazis has more on how the U.S. helped thwart the attack and what could happen now with the Israelis vowing retaliation.
title: How the U.S. is responding to Iran's missile attack against Israel

description: Former French teacher Peter Vlaming sued the school after his firing, alleging his constitutional right to speak freely and exercise his religion was violated.
title: School board settles with teacher fired for not using trans student's pronouns

description: New York City Mayor Eric Adams is set to appear in court Wednesday to face federal bribery and conspiracy charges. The judge could outline a preliminary timeline for Adams' trial. CBS News national correspondent Nikki Batiste has more.
title: NYC Mayor Eric Adams to appear in court on bribery charges, judge could outline trial timeline

description: The U.S. dockworker strike is in its second day after the union representing about 25,000 workers rejected a new proposal promising 50% raises over six years and limits on automation. CBS News correspondent Nancy Chen has more.
title: Dockworker strike hits day 2 after union rejects new proposal

description: New research suggests tropical cyclones, both hurricanes and tropical storms, drive thousands of deaths for years after a storm passes.
title: Hurricanes indirectly cause deaths for nearly 15 years after a storm, study finds

description: Employers are eyeing a health reimbursement arrangement in which they make tax-preferred contributions to employees to use to buy coverage on the individual market.
title: Benefit trend: Employers opt to give workers an allowance for health coverage

description: With the right strategies, experts say gold investing could be wise even at record highs. Here's what to know now.
title: Does gold investing make sense with the price high? Here's what experts say.

description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has promised retribution after Iran's major missile attack against Israel Tuesday. CBS News foreign correspondent Chris Livesay reports on the attack and CBS News White House reporter Willie James Inman has more on how President Biden is reacting.
title: Fallout continues from Iran attack on Israel with Israeli retaliation expected

description: The woman convicted of luring five young men into a Long Island park where they were attacked by MS-13 gang members that killed four of them​ was sentenced to 50 years in prison Tuesday.
title: MS-13 associate dubbed "La Diablita" sentenced to 50 years in prison

description: Jess Glynne, known for her hit "Don't Be So Hard on Yourself," is back in the U.S. following the release of her third album, "Jess." She joins "CBS Mornings Plus" to talk about her new tour.
title: Jess Glynne returns to the U.S. with new tour

description: Vice presidential candidates JD Vance and Tim Walz squared off in a policy-focused debate Tuesday night that's being praised for its civility. CBS News political director Fin Gómez has more on the takeaways from each candidate's performance and CBS News national correspondent Jericka Duncan reports on how some voters are reacting.
title: How the Vance-Walz debate played to undecided voters

description: Former NFL quarterback Colin Kaepernick and media personality Nessa Diab are with "CBS Mornings" for their first TV interview together. The couple co-founded the "Know Your Rights Camp" in 2015 with the mission of advancing the well-being of Black and Brown communities, through education and self-empowerment. Now, they are releasing their new children's book called "We Are Free, You and Me."
title: Colin Kaepernick and Nessa Diab on continuing activism through children's literature

description: CBS News correspondent Jericka Duncan watched Tuesday's VP debate in the politically diverse city of Grand Rapids, Michigan. People in the area voted for former President Donald Trump in 2016 and President Biden in 2020. A group of voters who are split on the candidates react to who they think won the debate.
title: How swing state voters viewed the vice presidential debate

description: During Day 1 of a dockworkers strike, Harold Daggett, president of the International Longshoremen's Association, was on a picket line in Elizabeth, New Jersey, telling CBS News New York, "Those greedy companies are making billions of dollars, and they don't want to share."
title: Dockworkers union President Harold Daggett speaks out on strike

description: Jeff Nebeker celebrates the success of his viral ceramic donuts, which sold out in just three minutes after being posted by gallery owner Michelle O'Brien. Over 9,000 people are on the email list for the next restock.
title: Pastry chef's ceramic donuts go viral, sell out in minutes

description: Workers inside a plastics factory in Tennessee say their employers waited too long to let them leave work.
title: 6 of 11 factory workers swept away by Helene flooding still missing

description: At the grand opening of her candy shop in NYC, Elly Ross welcomed hundreds of customers wanting a taste of viral Swedish candy. The self-proclaimed "candy connoisseur" talks about what makes foreign treats stand out.
title: Elly Ross on launching candy shop featuring imported treats

description: Modern forensic tests helped identify a suspect in the abduction of Morgan Nick, a 6-year-old who disappeared in Arkansas in 1995.
title: DNA found in truck leads to suspect in girl's 1995 abduction

description: Sen. JD Vance and Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz took the stage Tuesday night for the only vice presidential debate before the November election. While a CBS News poll shows most viewers thought the debate had a generally positive tone, the two candidates sparred over domestic topics like the economy, gun control and abortion.
title: Vance and Walz spar over gun control, economy, abortion at VP debate

description: Amanda Rice, a two-time breast cancer and skin cancer survivor, leads the "Chick Mission," supporting young women newly diagnosed with cancer by preserving their fertility and offering financial assistance.
title: "Chick Mission" founder on empowering women to preserve fertility during Cancer treatment

description: Emmy-winning "Barefoot Contessa" star Ina Garten  joins "CBS Mornings" to talk about her new memoir, childhood and how burnout from working in the White House led to her culinary success.
title: Ina Garten on new memoir, leaving the White House for a culinary career

description: On this "Mornings Memory," "Big Brother" premiered, changing the reality TV landscape forever. Eddie McGee and two runners-up share how the show impacted their lives.
title: "Mornings Memory:" The launch of "Big Brother"

description: CBS News Confirmed fact-checked several claims that Ohio Sen. JD Vance and Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz made during the vice presidential debate. CBS News chief Washington correspondent Major Garrett breaks down the results.
title: JD Vance, Tim Walz debate fact check

description: In the only vice presidential debate before the November election, Sen. JD Vance and Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz tackled pressing issues like the economy, gun control, and abortion. A CBS News poll reveals mixed reactions, with some voters craving more presidential debates while others express debate fatigue. Major Garrett breaks it down.
title: Fact checking the vice presidential debate

description: Mortgage interest rates are on the decline. Is now the time to refinance your mortgage? We asked some experts.
title: Should you refinance your mortgage this October? Here's what experts think.

description: Officials say more than 160 people have been found dead in six states after Hurricane Helene tore through the Southeast last week. On Wednesday, President Biden will visit North and South Carolina to survey the damage brought by the historic storm.
title: Biden to visit the Carolinas as search for Helene survivors continues

description: Democratic National Committee chair Jaime Harrison spoke to "CBS Mornings" about the vice presidential debate between Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz and Sen. JD Vance, and the state of the presidential race.
title: DNC chair reacts to vice presidential debate

description: The 14 ports that shut down in a strike handle about 80% of the coffee, tea, spirits and beverage imports as well as about 60% of medical and surgical instruments coming into the U.S. While many businesses knew the strike was coming and stocked up in advance, the strike could cost the economy up to $5 billion per day.
title: How the port strike could impact consumers

description: The U.S. vows severe consequences for Iran over its attack on Israel, but what those are remain unclear. President Biden has pushed for a cease-fire in Lebanon to avoid a wider war, but he also stressed the U.S. is fully supportive of Israel.
title: U.S. condemns Iran attack on Israel, says there will be consequences

description: Iran fired nearly 200 missiles at targets inside Israel on Tuesday, saying it was in retaliation for its assassination of Hezbollah and Hamas leaders. Israeli officials say the attack caused only minor damage.
title: Iran fires nearly 200 missiles at Israel

description: The vice presidential nominees strike a respectful tone in their debate, while they sharply disagree on policy. Also, Israel vows to hit back, after Iran launches its largest-ever missile attack against the Jewish state. All that and all that matters in today's Eye Opener.
title: Eye Opener: Tim Walz and JD Vance debate for the first and only time

description: The CBS News Confirmed team investigated claims made by both Senator JD Vance and Gov. Tim Walz during Tuesday night's debate. Rhona Tarrant, executive editor for CBS News Confirmed, has more.
title: More fact-checks from Vance and Walz's VP debate

description: Vice presidential candidates JD Vance and Tim Walz on Tuesday held what will likely be their only debate of the 2024 campaign. CBS News political director Fin Gómez reports on the matchup and a few of the highlights.
title: Recapping the VP debate between Vance and Walz

description: Former British Prime Minister Boris Johnson says in his memoir that he "had known for a year or more" that Queen Elizabeth II had bone cancer.
title: Former U.K. leader says in book that Queen Elizabeth II had bone cancer

description: A number of unexploded bombs dropped by the U.S. military during World War II have been unearthed in the area, officials said.
title: U.S. bomb from WWII explodes at airport in Japan; 80 flights canceled

description: The 12-month grace period for student loan borrowers ended Sept. 30. The "on-ramp" period helped borrowers struggling to make payments avoid the risk of defaulting and hurting their credit score.
title: End of student loans grace period a potentially perilous time for borrowers

description: The World Health Organization says there have been increasing reports of deadly outbreaks among mammals caused by influenza viruses, including H5N1.
title: Bird flu kills 47 tigers, 3 lions and a panther in Vietnam zoos

description: The Great Lakes mapping effort will pinpoint hundreds of shipwrecks, illuminate topographical features and identify fisheries, a marine scientist said.
title: Great Lakes mapping effort could reveal hundreds of shipwrecks

description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu vowed retaliation for Iran's missile attack against Israel, saying Tehran would "pay for it."
title: Netanyahu vows Israel will retaliate for Iran's missile attack

description: The 2024 vice presidential nominees, Republican JD Vance​​ and Democrat Tim Walz,​​ sparred​ over a wide range of issues in the VP debate, hosted by CBS News.
title: Watch a full replay of the Vance-Walz VP debate

description: Vice presidential candidates Gov. Tim Walz and Sen. JD Vance met in New York City on Tuesday night for their first and likely only 2024 showdown. Here are some highlights from the CBS News debate.
title: 6 highlights from the Walz-Vance VP debate

description: Ohio Sen. JD Vance and Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz faced off in their first and only scheduled vice presidential debate at the CBS Broadcast Center in New York City. Here are the highlights and analysis.
title: Highlights from JD Vance-Tim Walz vice presidential debate

description: CBS News polled voters nationally after Tuesday's vice presidential debate on the tone and who they think won. CBS News executive director of elections and surveys Anthony Salvanto breaks down the results.
title: Almost 9 in 10 thought VP debate tone was "generally positive," CBS News poll finds

description: Read the full transcript of the vice presidential debate hosted by CBS News between Sen. JD Vance and Gov. Tim Walz.
title: Read the full VP debate transcript from the Walz-Vance showdown

description: CBS News poll finds Walz and Vance improved their standing in what debate watchers said was a positive debate.
title: CBS News VP debate poll shows voter reactions to tonight's Vance-Walz showdown

description: Democratic Sen. Mark Kelly of Arizona joins "America Decides" post-debate to defend the Harris-Walz ticket's plans on immigration, the economy and more.
title: Sen. Mark Kelly defends Harris after Vance's criticism at VP debate

description: Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz and Ohio Sen. JD Vance faced off in the only scheduled vice presidential debate Tuesday, hosted by CBS News. CBS News' Major Garrett, Nancy Cordes, Robert Costa, Ed O'Keefe and Caitlin Huey-Burns give their post-debate analysis and share how the Trump and Harris campaigns are reacting.
title: How Trump and Harris campaigns are reacting to VP debate performances
